page.title: 03MOTORWAY M1
page.content: The construction of the {M1}began at Aldenham in 1959 and it was the first motorway to be opened in Britain, except for a small section of the {M6} to bypass Preston. The section of the M1 in our rectangle stretches right through our three western squares. Junction No 5 split{ {Berry Grove Wood}in half and the northward route had to cross {The {River Colne}by the first M1 bridge to be built. Junction 5 allowed {A41} users to enter the Motorway. Its route then cut off the eastern side of {Munden House's}land. After crossing the Watford to St Albans railway the Motorway leaves our rectangle through {Bricket Wood.}The Motorway at Aldenham was originally only four lane, but in 1982/83 this was increased to six lanes.
